intro: Dorstenia sabanensis, commonly known as the saban dwarf mala mujer, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive shape. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Dorstenia sabanensis is often grown as a houseplant due to its compact size and relatively low maintenance requirements.
